1.title: The First Meal
1.plot: The first episode, reveals how search and management of food was the driving force in shaping our world.

2.title: The Principle of Gastronomy
2.plot: The journey continues from ancient Athens and Sparta, to Alexander the Great and the Roman city of Delos. In this chapter we see how globalization affected our diet.

3.title: Melting Pot
3.plot: The third episode s begins with the emergence of Christianity that links its existence to poverty and food.

4.title: Two Worlds in a Kitchen
4.plot: The chapter "Two Worlds in a Kitchen" begins in the years of Ottoman domination and looks into how the food we eat today was shaped.

5.title: Neogreek Cuisine
5.plot: The last episode of the series, titled "Neogreek Cuisine", begins after the end of the Second World War, with the concept of the Mediterranean Diet by American scientists.

imdb.plot outline: A documentary series that presents the evolution of diet in Greece and the Mediterranean, in five hourly episodes chronologically dating back to Prehistoric times, Antiquity, Byzantium, Ottoman times, the modern Greek state, and today's Greece. The documentary is a journey into the history of food, starting 500,000 years ago and reaching to this day. Including recent scientific researches, recent archaeological discoveries, historical records, rare films, 3D animations, and dramatic representations of everyday life from a prehistoric era to this day.
imdb.title: To taxidi tis trofis
plot: A documentary series that presents the evolution of diet in Greece and the Mediterranean.::Noel Kardaris

A documentary series that presents the evolution of diet in Greece and the Mediterranean, in five hourly episodes chronologically dating back to Prehistoric times, Antiquity, Byzantium, Ottoman times, the modern Greek state, and today's Greece. The documentary is a journey into the history of food, starting 500,000 years ago and reaching to this day. Including recent scientific researches, recent archaeological discoveries, historical records, rare films, 3D animations, and dramatic representations of everyday life from a prehistoric era to this day.::Noel Kardaris
